comment: For young Bourbon, this one isn't too bad. The Sherry influence is pronounced and tames the obvious youth. It's not bad, but not really great.
Very palatable, dry and oaky. One of the best that I’ve had for the price. Definitely recommend.
Pecan, Vanilla, Butterscotch. Nice Oak but not over bearing.
Very pleasant bourbon. A little spicy bite at the front but finishes of smooth caramel.
sharp start, but sweet and smooth finish
Loved the smoky nose.  Overall smooth, sweet but not overly, nice finish.   Very unique and delicious bourbon, and one of my favorite that I’ve tasted.
Sweet woody with a nice bite. Sweet smooth caramel finish.

Interesting new bourbon. Great aroma of vanilla and Oak. Extremely smooth over ice. Has a cherry, vanilla, Oak and berry flavor, with a very smooth finish. I like it a lot. One of the top bourbons I’ve tasted. Hope this stuff doesn’t sell out like Blantons or Pappi.

Nose: More sweetness than oak. Leather is in the distance.

Taste: Very sweet. A candy sweetness that seems almost slightly artificial. The oak is very much in the background compared to the sweetness. Does not taste as young as you would expect.
Sweet like honey on the front, super smooth finish. Not hot at all. Second sip was more oak, but not over powering
A little oily, sweet, and very fragrant
Too sweet and very little complexity.
Silky smooth. Caramel, cinnamon with a surprising lemon note. Did not get a the barrel flavors I expected from a oak infused bourbon.

This is in the sherry-finish division of my finished bourbon bracket. It was Joseph Magnus vs Noble Oak, winner to go against Wild Turkey Revival. In a blind taste test, Joseph Magnus won. As always... this is for science.

Blind was kind of impossible. Although price doesn’t always mean better, $90 vs $30 was meaningful here. I wasn’t fooled for a second.

The oak is strong with this one. Doubled, some might say. The nose immediately lets me know what I’m getting into: heavy oak scent mixed with artificial banana flavoring. It’s reminiscent of Woodford Double Oaked in that way. Body is a hit of that same banana flavor, and the finish carries away an almost imperceptible raisin flavor, again overpowered by that artificial banana. The main recognizable sherry influence is a dry mouth feel on the finish.

For those of you who dig Woodford Doubled Oaked, this is a variant on that flavor profile at 60% the cost. I’m not convinced that banana/oak is the most compatible flavor profile for a sherry finish, but it’s interesting.
Super sweet.  Tastes like a dessert wine. Better with chocolate.
Sweet notes of vanilla and carmel with an oak finish. Reminds me of WR Double Oaked but sweeter. 4/5.
Sweet and woody nose, slight spice body, smooth warm finish
Drank on the rocks: Smooth/sweet little spice on finish.
Oak Sherry on the nose, same in first sip, then candied cherries and maple syrupy notes come through. Long, warm finish.

Nose: walnuts, butterscotch, coconut, maple, damp oak shavings, very unique nose 

Palate: very smooth, light oak, 
gingerbread, banana, cherry, cinnamon, cardamom 

Finish: oak, honey

Nose
• Honey, young whiskey, young oak, rye, spice, heat, 

Taste
• Smooth, sugar, cherry, spice, heat
Sweet and spicy, kind of a mild fruity flavor in there somewhere. Harsher, bitter finish, but overall I dig it!
Sharp grassy aroma, same flavor too. Light wood and grass, thin body. Not really my style.
Aged in Sherry Barrels and White Oak barrels. First you smell and taste the Sherry Barrels with a smooth vanilla/oak finish.
Smooth with a hint of vanilla
Smooth on the outset with a slight build which mellows nicely.  Taste is smooth and not any over powering flavor of oak or caramels but still pleasant.
A smooth, but a touch weak, bourbon

I love this whiskey. It's hard to fool time, but they do a pretty good job of it. There's some damp wood mixed on with the vanilla and cherry notes, stone graham cracker, and butter. I've noticed that if this whiskey is served too cold, it acquires a bitter lacquer-like smell, that subsides as it warms, which can be confusing. My first experience was very positive, and when I went back the second time, all the good notes were covered up by that smell until it warmed in my hands.
A great find. Smooth vanilla on the front, bit of heat, maple lingers on finish.
Cherry Vanilla finish with spices hitting you up front. Smooth and tasty
Very smooth & sweet bourbon. A little spicy at the front but finishes of smooth caramel and vanilla with subtle hints of banana.

Nose: log cabin syrup covered green apple 

Taste: not nearly as bold as the nose, but the flavors stay true

Finish: suuuuuper sweet up front, with a decently long finish.
Vanilla maple syrup on the nose. Not great but not bad

The nose offers dried fruit and smoke dominating the first time. As it sits the fruit settles and offers some brown sugar. The palate is more subtle. The smoke disappears and flavors are soft The finish is rounded and medium-long. Overall, it is good and reasonably priced.
Very smooth neat and sweet bourbon, at this price point I’m still with buffalo trace though
Very Smokey with a hint of rye. Very smooth
WSell, It not up to par with well aged bourbons. Sorry.
Leathery with oak and then it sweetens. Gets better each time I have a pour.
Full vanilla flavor but not overpowering. Oakiness is there as well as a lightness I can't fully describe. Easy to drink and extremely enjoyable.
